contest-event.event-date:
March 26, 1966 D North West Area (Fourth Section)
North West Area (Fourth Section) 40 Test Piece Contest North West Area north-west-area-fourth-section National Championship of Great Britain (Fourth Section Final)
North West
Fourth
On the Pier
Town Hall, Birkenhead Placings from British Bandsman, 16/4/1966. However, the 1966 National final had 4 bands from the North West - Skelmersdale, Ellesmere, Stacksteads and Poulton le Fylde, and Ellesmere were originally recorded 2nd in this BBR entry (and were the only band listed by the enterer). Does anybody know the story? Were Royal Buckley perhaps later disqualified?
Is "On The Pier" the correct test piece? Other areas used "Everybody's Child" by Eric Ball in the same year for the fourth section, and it isn't recorded anywhere else in the database.
Feb. 18, 2011, 10:10 a.m. Nov. 8, 2013, 3:22 p.m.
1 Skelmersdale Prize Band William Lyon
2 Royal Buckley Town Band J. K. Lloyd
3 Ellesmere Port Silver Band E. G. Edwards
4 Stacksteads Brass Band C. Griffiths
